description: [Leadership] The minister of Information and National Orientation, Mohammed Idris, will represent President Bola Ahmed Tinubu as the head of Nigeria's delegation to the Second Indonesia-Africa Forum in Bali, Indonesia, from September 1st to 3rd, 2024.
title: Africa: Idris Represents Nigeria At Second Indonesia-Africa Forum

description: [Premium Times] Governor AbdulRazaq says Eniola's feat underlines the roles of hard work, brilliance, determination, and equitable opportunity in how individuals and societies succeed
title: Africa: Gov Abdulrazaq Celebrates Eniola Over Africa's First Paralympic Win

description: [ISS] The pattern of targeting detention facilities shows that insurgents are determined to break their members out of prison.
title: Africa: Growing Danger of Terrorist Jailbreaks in West Africa

description: [Daily News] TANZANIA: ON September 4th, 2024, the Forum on Africa-China Cooperation (FOCAC) shall convene in Beijing, China, under the theme "Joining Hands to Advance Modernisation and Build a High-level China-Africa Community with a Shared Future."
title: Africa: Toward New Historical Milestone of Sinoafrican Friendship - What Focac Means

description: [Ghanaian Times] The President of Pan Africa-Ghana (PAG), a non-governmental organisation (NGO), Ras Caleb Appiah-Levi, will lead a five-member delegation to participate in the "1st Africa Youth Congress 2024, in Kampala, Uganda" from September 10 to 11.
title: Africa: RAS Caleb Appiah-Levi Leads Pan Africa-Ghana Delegation to Participate in 1st Africa Youth Congress

description: [The Point] Recently, the 3rd Plenary Session of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) was successfully held, at which the Resolution of the CPC on Further Deepening Reform Comprehensively to Advance Chinese Modernization was adopted, comprehensively breaking down the grand blueprint of advancing Chinese modernization by further deepening reform comprehensively, and comprehensively advancing the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation through Chinese modernization.
title: Africa: Opening New Chapter for China-Africa Relations and Embarking On a New Journey of Modernization Hand in Hand

description: [World Bank] Nairobi -- The World Bank has appointed Mr. Qimiao Fan as the new Country Director for Kenya, Rwanda, Somalia, and Uganda, effective September 1, 2024. Mr. Fan, who has over 35 years of experience in development practice, will oversee the design and implementation of the World Bank's support program to the four countries that has an active portfolio consisting of 102 projects totaling $17.2 billion.
title: Africa: World Bank Appoints New Country Director for Kenya, Rwanda, Somalia, and Uganda

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa, -- Health, Humanitarian Affairs and Social Development Commissioner at the African Union (AU), Minata Samate Cessouma commended the government of Ethiopia for championing the continental adolescent nutrition campaign.
title: Africa: AU Commends Ethiopia's Nutrition Strategy to Ensure Wellbeing of Adolescents, Youth

description: [African Union] The African Union Commission (AUC) concluded a successful three-day consultation on Common African Position on Climate Change, Peace and Security from 27 to 29 August 2024, in Nairobi, Kenya. The event aimed to tackle the complex intersection of climate change, peace and security by addressing policy gaps, enhancing technical capacities, securing funding, and improving decision-making processes.
title: Africa: AU Member States Consultation On Common African Position On Climate Change, Peace and Security Concludes, Fostering Greater Collaboration

description: [WHO] UNICEF today announced that it has issued an emergency tender for the procurement of mpox vaccines. Vaccines can play a critical role in containing the mpox outbreak which was declared a public health emergency by both the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) and the World Health Organization (WHO).
title: Africa: Unicef Issues Emergency Tender to Secure Mpox Vaccines for Crisis-Hit Countries in Collaboration With Africa CDC, Gavi and WHO

description: [The Conversation Africa] The ninth Forum on China-Africa Cooperation in Beijing takes place under the theme of "Joining hands to advance modernisation and build a high-level China-Africa community with a shared future". But how shared can that future be between the Asian economic giant and Africa?
title: Africa: China Reaps Most of the Benefits of Its Relationship With Africa - What's Behind the Imbalance

description: [Africa CDC] The Journal for Public Health in Africa, in collaboration with Africa CDC, invites applications for a Manuscript Writing Workshop to be held on the sidelines of the upcoming Conference for Public Health in Africa that will be held in Rabat, Morocco.
title: Africa: Call for Applications Manuscript Writing Workshop

description: [The Conversation Africa] China's relationship with Africa is vital to Beijing's efforts to expand its influence in the western-dominated world order. China is Africa's most significant trading partner and a crucial source of continental investment. Hence the importance of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation to both.
title: Africa: African Nations Can Do More to Benefit From Ties With China, the World's Second-Strongest Economy

description: [The Conversation Africa] China-Africa relations have deepened over the past two decades, characterised by increased economic cooperation, investment and infrastructure development. China is now Africa's largest trading partner, with partnerships focused on building roads, railways and energy projects.
title: Africa: China's Interests in Africa Are Being Shaped By the Race for Renewable Energy

description: [The Conversation Africa] China-Africa cooperation has evolved over the past 24 years.
title: Africa: China-Africa Relations - New Priorities Have Driven Major Shifts Over the Last 24 Years - 5 Essential Reads
